tn.ref: a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ
tn.text: a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ - The phrase "I am" is implied (See: [[:en:ta:vocabulary:implicitexplicit|Explicit and Implicit Information]]). You could make it clearer with a new sentence: "I am a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ."
<b>to establish - <b>  "to firmly set in place"
which agrees with godliness - "that agrees with God's rules" or "which is good for holy people"
God, who is without lies - "God, who is never lies"

tn.ref: before all the ages of time.
tn.text: <b>before all the ages of time.<b>  - "before time began"
God our Savior - "God, who saved us" (See: UDB).
my true son - Since Titus was not Paul's actual son, this could be translated as "you are like a son to me." (UDB)
Grace, mercy, and peace - This was a common greeting. This can also be translated as "May grace, mercy, and peace be yours" or "may you experience kindness, mercy, and peace within."
This can also be translated as "This is the reason"
This could be translated as "I told you to stay in Crete."
That is, "appoint elders" (See: UDB) or "designate elders"

tn.ref: An elder must be without blame
tn.text: An elder must be without blame - (See UDB). This could also be translated using a positive description: "with integrity" or "with a good reputation."

<b>husband of one wife - <b>  This phrase means "a one-woman man." It is normally translated as "must have only one wife" (UDB). It is debated as to whether this excludes men who have been previously widowed or divorced, or single men.
faithful children - Possible meanings for this phrase are 1) "children who believe (in Jesus) or 2) simply "children who are trustworthy."
not categorized as - "not known as" or "do not have the reputation as"
undisciplined - "rebellious" or "does not follow rules"

tn.ref: It is necessary for the overseer
tn.text: It is necessary for the overseer - This could be translated as "An overseer must."
God's house manager - "a steward of God," or "as one responsible for the house of God."
not addicted to wine - "not an alcoholic" or "not a drunkard" or "does not drink too much wine"
brawler - "violent" or "who likes to fight" (UDB)
This could be translated as "hospitable."

tn.ref: a friend of what is good
tn.text: "love the things that are good" (UDB)
"be devoted to" or "know well" or "have a strong understanding of"
This could be translated as "the truth of the word" or "the teaching of the word that is faithful."
"what is healthy" or "what is correct"
"those who have been circumcised" or "those who practice circumcision." This refers to the Jews, who were circumcised.
"things that are not proper to teach"
for shameful profit - "so that people will give them money. This is very shameful!" (UDB). This refers to profit that people make by doing things that are not honorable.
"One of the Cretans" or "Someone from the people of Crete"
This can be translated as "someone his people thought was a prophet" (UDB).
"Cretans are lying all the time" or "Cretans never stop lying." The is an exaggeration. (See: [[:en:ta:figuresofspeech:hyperbole]])
This metaphor compares the Cretans to dangerous beasts. See: [[:en:ta:figuresofspeech:metaphor]])
"lazy gluttons" or "people who do nothing but eat too much food." This figure of speech uses the image of their stomachs to describe the whole person. (See: [[:en:ta:figuresofspeech:synecdoche]])
So sharply correct them - "Therefore tell them strongly that they are wrong"

tn.ref: that they may be sound in the faith
tn.text: that they may be sound in the faith - "so they will have a healthy faith" or "so they will believe the truth" or "so their faith may be true"
"So not spend time listening to"
This refers to the false teaching of the Jews.
"cause people to stop believing in"

tn.ref: To the pure man, all is pure
tn.text: This can be translated as "Everything is pure to the one who is pure" or "If someone is pure inside, everything they do will be pure."
"clean" or "acceptable to God"

tn.ref: to the polluted and unbelieving man, nothings is pure
tn.text: This can be translated as "the one who is morally defiled and who does not believe cannot be pure."
polluted - "morally unclean" or "corrupt" or "defiled"
"their actions demonstrate that they do not know him"
detestable - "disgusting"

tn.ref: prove to be unfit for any good work
tn.text: "show themselves to be unqualified for any good work" or "demonstrate that they are unable to do anything good"
This could be translated as "But you, Titus, in contrast with the false teachers."
"with sound doctrine" or "with correct teachings"
temperate - "sober minded" or "self-controlled." This could be translated as "rule themselves."
sensible - "self-controlled" or "in control of their desires."
sound - This describes the next three things: faith, love, and perseverance. To be "sound" means to be "healthy."
"with healthy faith" or "correct in their beliefs"
"with healthy love"
(sound) in perseverance - "steadfast" or "constant" or "untiring"
likewise - "in the same way." This could be translated as "as you instruct the older men, instruct the older women as well."
should always present themselves - "should be" or "should live as"
gossips - The word that is translated here as "gossips" means "devils" or "slanderers" or "enemies." It here refers to people who say bad things about other people whether they are true or not."
balanced in their thinking - "think wisely"
be pure - Could be translated as "think good thoughts and do good actions" or "think clean thoughts and do good things."

tn.ref: so that God's word may not be condemned
tn.text: so that God's word may not be condemned - "so that God's message will not be rejected." This could be translated as "so that God's word will not be criticized or rejected because of what the women do."
in the same way - This refers back to the training of the women in the church. Titus was to train the men in a similar manner.
call - "teach" or "tell" or "exhort"
present yourself - This could be translated as "You should be" or "Show yourself to be."
a model of good works - "an example of doing right and proper things"
healthy words beyond reproach - "teaching that does not contain any error"

tn.ref: would bring shame upon someone if he tried to oppose you
tn.text: would bring shame upon someone if he tried to oppose you - This presents a hypothetical situation where someone opposes Titus and is himself shamed as a result. It is not expressing a current event. Your language may have a way of expressing this. (See: [[:en:ta:discourse:hypothetical]])
their masters - "their own masters"
in everything - "in every situation" or "always"
please them - This could be translated as "make their masters happy" or "satisfy their masters."
show good faith - This could be translated as "be faithful to their masters" or "demonstrate they are worthy of their masters' trust."
God our Savior - "our God who saves us"
The word translated as "attractive" has the meaning of a something such as a gift being decorated to make it desirable.
in every way - "in everything they do."
You see - "Titus, you understand"

tn.ref: the grace of God that is able to bring salvation to everyone has appeared
tn.text: the grace of God that is able to bring salvation to everyone has appeared - This can also be translated as "the saving grace of God has come to light for everyone."
has appeared - "come to light" or "become visible"
trains us to deny ungodliness - "teaches us to do right things." This could be translated as "teaches us to resist temptation to do wrong things."
trains us - This is a figure of speech that presents the grace of God as a person who trains and disciplines others to live holy lives. (See: [[:en:ta:figuresofspeech:personification]])
worldly passions - "strong desires for the things of this world" or "strong desires for earthly pleasures"
in this age - "while we live in this world" or "during this time"
we look to receive - "We wait to welcome"

tn.ref: the appearance of the glory of
tn.text: The words "appearance" and "glory" can be combined to say "the glorious appearance of." (See: [[:en:ta:figuresofspeech:hendiadys]])
gave himself for us - "gave himself to die for us"

tn.ref: to set us free from lawlessness
tn.text: to set us free from lawlessness - "to release us from our sinful condition." This is a metaphor that compares being released from sin's control to the freedom of a slave being purchased by someone. (See: [[en:ta:figuresofspeech:metaphor|Metaphor]])
make pure - "cleanse"
a treasured people - This could be translated as "a group of people that he treasures."
are eager - "have a strong desire"

tn.ref: speak of and encourage these things
tn.text: This could be translated as "teach these things and encourage the hearers to do these things."
"correct those people who do not do these things"
"Do not allow anyone to"
disregard you - This could be translated as "refuse to listen to your words" or "refuse to respect you."
"Tell the people at church again what they already know," or "Keep reminding them."
These words are similar, and used together to include everyone who holds authority in the government.

tn.ref: be ready for every good work
tn.text: be ready for every good work - "be ready to do good whenever there is opportunity"
revile - "speak evil of"

tn.ref: let other people have their way
tn.text: This can be translated as "be gentle"
For - "Because"
"formerly" or "at some time" or "previously"
thoughtless - "foolish" or "unwise"

tn.ref: led astray and enslaved by various passions and pleasures
tn.text: led astray and enslaved by various passions and pleasures - This metaphor compares the way our sinful desires control us to slavery. (See: [[:en:ta:figuresofspeech:metaphor|Metaphor]]) This could be translated as "our sinful wishes make us slaves to our strong desires for pleasure."
led astray - This could be translated as "deceived."
passions - "lusts" or "desires"
This could be translated as "We were always doing evil things  and wanting what someone else has."
We were detestable - "We were worthy of being hated." This could be translated as "We caused others to hate us."

tn.ref: when the kindness of God our Savior and his love towards mankind appeared
tn.text: when the kindness of God our Savior and his love towards mankind appeared - This could be translated as "when God our Savior displayed his love and kindness to people."
"saved us by means of" or "saved us by"
washing of new birth - This could be translated as "making us inside by our spiritual new birth."
renewal - "being made new." This could be translated as "the Holy Spirit made us new" or "The Holy Spirit made us new people."

tn.ref: because of works which we have done in righteousness
tn.text: "because we do good things" (DUB)
according to - "in the same measure as"

tn.ref: poured the Holy Spirit on us
tn.text: This is a metaphor resembling the anointing of priests. (See: [[en:bible:notes:key-terms:anoint]]) This could be translated as "gave the Holy Spirit to us generously."
"eternal"
"abundantly" or "generously"
through our Savior Jesus Christ - "when Jesus saved us"
This could be translated as "We have already been made righteous by God"
we became heirs - This could be translated as "God made us sons with rights of inheritance."

tn.ref: of the hope of eternal life
tn.text: of the hope of eternal life - "and we know for certain that we have eternal life"
This refers to the statement about God giving us the Holy Spirit through Jesus in the previous verse.
<b>that he put before them - <b>  This can be translated as "that God gave to them to do."
"But you, Titus"
foolish debates - "arguments concerning unimportant matters"
strife - "quarreling"
"God's law"
reject - This could be translated as "Do not interact with" or "Do not spend time with" or "avoid"
after one or two warnings - "after you have warned that person once or twice"
"a person like that"
This could be translated as "bring judgment upon himself."
"After I send"
Artemas, Nicopolis, Zenas - (See: [[:en:ta:translate:translatenames]])
"stay for the winter"
"You hurry and come" or "Come quickly"
"You hurry" or "Do not delay in sending"
"and also send Apollos"
set before themselves - "be busy doing"

tn.ref: so that they may not be unfruitful
tn.text: so that they may not be unfruitful - This double-negative can also be stated positively: "so they will be fruitful" or "so they can produce fruit for God" or "so their lives will be useful." (See: [[:en:ta:vocabulary:double-negatives]])
"All the people"

tn.ref: those who love us in faith-
tn.text: <b>those who love us in faith- <b> Possible meanings are 1) "the believers who love us" or 2) "the believers who love us because we share the same belief."

tn.ref: Grace be with all of you-
tn.text: <b>Grace be with all of you- <b>  This was a common Christian greeting. It can also be translated as "May God's grace be with you" or "I ask that God will be gracious to all of you."
